creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
poem(kyo_ku):small lanterns lent by O_noshi restaurant flickering up and down by Kabuki
(that's my best guess, I'm not sure what the poem meaning)
Japanese: Kyo_ku-sha; O_noshi to kashi ueshita no ko-cho_chin, Kabuki
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Collection of Famous Restaurants in Edo (Edo kōmei kaitei zukushi 江戸高名会亭尽)
title: Ōnoshi at Yanagibashi in Ryōgoku
